intro: Acaena grossifolia, commonly known as the large-leaved burr bush, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Rosaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and dense, spiny fruits. The plant produces small white or pink flowers that bloom in spring, followed by spherical, hairy fruits that contain seeds. Acaena grossifolia thrives in coastal and subalpine habitats, often forming dense shrubs. Its unique morphology and ecological role make it an important species in New Zealand's native flora.
